message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.MM, cs.GT 

This paper deals with the downlink of a cellular network with multiple cells and multi-antenna base stations, which involves information theory (cs.IT), networking and internet architecture (cs.NI), signal processing (cs.SI), multimedia (cs.MM), and game theory (cs.GT). The paper proposes an analytic method based on the combination of the large random matrix theory with Lagrangian optimization, which is a mathematical approach that is commonly used in information theory and signal processing. Therefore, cs.IT and cs.SI are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also considers fairness requirements, which are relevant to networking and internet architecture (cs.NI) and game theory (cs.GT). Finally, the paper provides numerical examples of different cell layouts, which are related to multimedia (cs.MM).
